summary: This document appears to be an internal email or chat transcript discussing a reluctance to send an email about Jeffrey Epstein, possibly related to legal or professional concerns. The sender expresses frustration about inefficient communication practices and mentions fears of testifying and losing a license.

events.title: Internal discussion about Epstein email
events.description: An internal discussion occurs about who should send an email regarding Jeffrey Epstein, with one person refusing due to fears of being called to testify and potential professional consequences.

keyFacts: The document records a discussion on July 24, 2019, about sending an email related to Jeffrey Epstein.
One individual refuses to send the email due to fear of being called to testify and potentially losing their professional license.
The communication criticizes inefficient email practices within the organization, specifically mentioning unnecessary forwarding and delegation.
